solution_line_template: She watches {minutes_per_night} minutes of tv per night, {weekdays_per_week} days a week so that's {minutes_per_night}*{weekdays_per_week} = <<{minutes_per_night}*{weekdays_per_week}={weekday_minutes_per_week}>>{weekday_minutes_per_week} minutes of tv

She watches {weekend_hours} hours of tv on the weekends and {minutes_per_hour} minutes are in 1 hour so that's {weekend_hours}*{minutes_per_hour} = <<{weekend_hours}*{minutes_per_hour}={weekend_minutes_per_week}>>{weekend_minutes_per_week} minutes of tv

All total she watches {weekday_minutes_per_week}+{weekend_minutes_per_week} = <<{weekday_minutes_per_week}+{weekend_minutes_per_week}={total_minutes_per_week}>>{total_minutes_per_week} minutes of tv per week

There are {total_weeks} weeks in a year and she watches {total_minutes_per_week} minutes per week so that's {total_weeks}*{total_minutes_per_week} = <<{total_weeks}*{total_minutes_per_week}={total_minutes_per_year}>>{total_minutes_per_year} minutes of tv per year

She watches {total_minutes_per_year} minutes of tv and {minutes_per_hour} minutes are in an hour so she watches {total_minutes_per_year}/{minutes_per_hour} = <<{total_minutes_per_year}/{minutes_per_hour}={total_hours_per_year}>>{total_hours_per_year} hours
